bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jerome Greenfield wrote the book, Wilhelm Reich vs. the U. S. A (1974) about the prosecution of the famous German-born, and one-time Communist psychiatrist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains Reich's writings and correspondence relative to his life as a scientist and Communist as well as copies of others' writing on orgonomics and other Reichian concepts. Includes records of Reich's legal battles against the United States Food and Drug Administration as well as materials on his imprisonment, including correspondence from jail with his daughter Eva. Also of note is correspondence between Reich and Albert Einstein and between Reich and Sergei Eisenstein. PLEASE DIRECT FURTHER INQUIRIES TO: peter.filardo@nyu.edu
